title: BBC Local Live: Shropshire Friday 23 December 2016 - BBC News

documents.title: bolton wanderers 2-1 shrewsbury town
text: bolton wanderers 2-1 shrewsbury town

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: live updates have finished for the day - we 'll be back from 08:00 on wednesday with more live news , sport , travel and weather .
have a great christmas .

documents.title: weather : this evening 's weather forecast
text: it looks like gusts of wind and showers are on the way this evening .
maximum temperature of 11c ( 52f ) .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Weather

documents.title: coming up on bbc midlands today : 'frantic friday '
text: it 's been dubbed `` frantic friday '' as people hit the roads , railways and airports to get away to visit family and friends for christmas .
we 'll have the latest on bbc midlands today at 18:30 on bbc one .

documents.title: storm barabara : strong wind and heavy rain possible
text: the environment agency is warning that storm barbara will be passing through shropshire this afternoon , producing a chance of strong gusts and heavy rain .
watch out as # stormbarbara cold front moves through later .
some squally conditions - very strongs gusts & heavy rain .
thanks dave , shopping done !
dog walked !
pub visited !
time to batten down the hatches !

documents.title: christmas support parcels given to hundreds of telford families
text: three hundred and sixty five christmas meal packages are being distributed to families who need them in telford .
it 's part of a project by the telford crisis network , who have thanked people in the community for their donations and hard work packing them .
every 20 minutes , someone will come to the store with a box full of food .
the more people we can help , the better . ''
author: Alex Seftel
BBC Local Live

documents.title: baby alpaca a christmas 'miracle '
text: when amy plaskett was given two female alpacas as a surprise wedding present from husband james , she had no idea one would give birth for christmas .
unbeknown to the couple , who live near shrewsbury , one of them was already pregnant .
and the baby has arrived just as the festivities begin , suitably named holly .
author: Jennifer Meierhans
BBC News Online

documents.title: headlines : m54 accident near wellington ; telford families get christmas support
text: as we head into the evening , these are the main shropshire stories we are working on :
- crash causing severe delays on m54 , heading eastbound from wellington
- telford crisis network prepare 365 christmas meal packages for local families in need
- southwater christmas market declared a success , with thousands of visitors
author: Alex Seftel
BBC Local Live

documents.title: turkey produces christmas windfall for shropshire farmer
text: reading this might make you hungry !
condover potato farmer david cartwright also grows turkeys , something he started doing to make some extra cash when he was an agricultural student years ago .
he 's expecting around 800 customers to drop by at home farm today and tomorrow to up their christmas birds .

documents.title: travel : a41 reopens after crash
text: the a41 , near press heath has now been reopened following an earlier accident involving two vehicles .
police say there are no reports of serious injuries .
there are some delays between chelmarsh and highley because a fallen tree is blocking the b4555 between the two south shropshire villages .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: homeless centre opening in telford in the new year
text: a new centre to help people who are homeless or who are suffering with mental illness is set to open its doors in 2017 .
the hope is that the new building , which will be in telford , will eventually be open 24 hours a day .
simon tooth from big red 's house is behind the idea .
the idea is eventually to be going 24/7 so we never close , because evenings are the time when people suffer the most . ''

documents.title: southwater christmas market to return in 2017
text: telford 's european christmas market at southwater is to return next year .
the organisers say it 's been a big success , bringing thousands of extra visitors to the area .
organisers say there 'll be a slightly different layout next time - with a more diverse range of stalls .
the aim was always to start off with a quality offer rather than something that tried to compete with big city rivals and we feel that approach has worked . ''
author: Alex Seftel
BBC Local Live

documents.title: heading home for christmas ? : warnings about tailbacks and weather
text: a combination of weather and maintenance on the roads and rail are expected to make the christmas getaway more difficult later .
millions of people will be heading off for the festive period but drivers are being warned about tailbacks and engineering works could make it tough on the trains .
an amber weather warning has been issued because storm barbara is on its way .

documents.title: travel : two roads blocked and causing delays
text: there are delays south of prees heath on the a41 because of an accident .
the a525 wrexham to whitchurch road is also blocked between the villages of bangor-on-dee and horseman 's green because a car has overturned .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: man gets three-year football banning order
text: a football yob from telford will miss out on the traditional festive fixtures after police secured a three-year banning order against him .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: headlines : farm shop condemns burglary ; telford market back next christmas
text: here are some of the shropshire stories we are working on in the newsroom :
- shropshire farm shop owner condemns thieves for stealing staff christmas bonuses
- telford christmas market will have `` more diverse range of stalls '' in 2017
- police out to stop festive drink-driving
author: Alex Seftel
BBC Local Live

documents.title: telford looking for festive return to winning ways
text: after an up and down first half of the season , afc telford united 's dave hibbert says the bucks need a boxing day win against alfreton town .
results elsewhere this week have seen them slip to 17th in the national league north table .
the former shrewsbury town striker is hoping for more consistency after christmas , with a run of victories to ease the club 's relegation fears .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: watch : otters released back into the wild
text: a pair of orphaned otters that were found last christmas eve have been released back to the wild .
they were taken into rspca care following storms on the rea brook in shrewsbury and were looked after at the stapeley grange wildlife centre in cheshire , before being released in shropshire .
this video follows their story .

documents.title: police out to stop festive drink-driving
text: west mercia police have issued their annual plea to motorists to stay away from drink and drugs if you 're planing on driving .
over the past three years , 16 people have been killed and 185 seriously injured in west mercia and warwickshire in cases where alcohol and drugs have been a contributory factor .
a campaign tasked with catching guilty drivers has been running throughout december .

documents.title: shropshire farm shop owner dismayed by stolen christmas bonuses
text: the owner of a farm shop has condemned thieves who broke in and stole some of the staff 's christmas bonuses .
apley farm shop on the a442 near shifnal was burgled on wednesday morning .
three laptops , a projector , a camera and the petty cash safe were taken from the business owned by harriet hamilton and her husband gavin .
it 's horrendous .
if you need some money , apply for a job , come and work for it like everyone else does at the farm shop do n't do this . ''

documents.title: tns are top of the tree for christmas
text: the new saints will be smiling at christmas , knowing they could equal a world record in top tier league football in their next game .
they host cefn druids in a welsh premier game in oswestry on boxing day with 25 straight victories behind them - one behind what the dutch side ajax managed in 1972 .
craig harrison 's side are already 21 points clear at the top of the table .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: 'jack 's army ' marches on
text: this christmas will be desperately sad for the family of little jack edwards whose short life inspired people throughout ludlow and south shropshire and in tenbury and the teme valley .
author: Ludlow & Tenbury Wells Advertiser

documents.title: shropshire bishop wants everyone to share hope of the christmas story
text: the bishop of lichfield says we need to look out for people who may be lonely and isolated over christmas .
the right reverend michael ipgrave is the lead bishop for the church of england area that includes telford and north shropshire .
whether you 're on your own , whether you 're feeling sad that story and that hope [ of christmas ] is there for everybody . ''

documents.title: lilleshall-based british gymnastics marks 'best ever ' year
text: the head of british gymnastics , based at lilleshall , has looked back on what she describes a `` monumental year , our best ever '' .
the rio olym were undoubtedly the highlight , with seven medals in all , including max whitlock crowned double olympic champion and amy tinkler winning britain 's first ever floor medal .
`` the sport and our organisation is going through an incredible period , '' chief executive jane allen said .
the organisation said an extra 100,000 people had also taken up gymnastics recreationally , since 2012 .

documents.title: headlines : fresh appeal over m54 body ; telford christmas market to return
text: as we head into the afternoon , these are some of the local stories we are looking at in the newsroom :
- family of man whose body was found by m54 thought he 'd `` got up and left ''
- telford christmas market will be back in 2017
- shropshire hospital bosses calm fears over eye surgery waiting lists
author: Alex Seftel
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'i was told he left with another woman '
text: 'i was told he left with another woman '

documents.title: weather : wet and windy this afternoon
text: there 's some wind and patches of rain on the way .
highs of 11c ( 52f ) .

documents.title: hospital bosses address concerns over eye treatment delays
text: shropshire health bosses have reassured people with eye conditions that they may still be seen - at least initially - within the county .

earlier this week , shrewsbury & telford hospital nhs trust said it would not accept new referrals for eye conditions including glaucoma for the first six months of 2017 - meaning those patients would have to travel to hospitals out of the county .
the chair of shropshire 's clinical commissioning group , dr julian povey says that lots of patients will still be seen by their local community-based service .
those who need consultant care will then have to go to other trusts .

documents.title: football : hurst longs for simpler transfers
text: the shrewsbury town manager paul hurst has described the complexity of signing new players .
the town are fighting relegation in league one and want to bring in several new players during the january transfer window .
but hurst , who is in his first season as a football league manager says it can be harder than it looks .
at some clubs it just seems there 's just an endless chain of people it has to go through and then you throw the agent into that and it becomes a lot more complicated . ''
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: staff christmas bonuses stolen in 'awful ' raids on shropshire farm shop 's offices
text: a farm shop has been burgled and staff christmas bonuses stolen just days before christmas
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: fresh appeal over m54 skull discovery
text: fresh appeal over m54 skull discovery

documents.title: shropshire parents facing up to being without missing son at christmas
text: a south shropshire couple are refusing to give up hope of their son returning one day .
andrew green , 33 , went missing from the family farm in chorley , near bridgnorth , in june .
there have been numerous searches - including one last weekend .
andrew 's parents julie and edward green say the last six months have had ups and downs and things will be especially tough at christmas .

documents.title: four things you wanted to know
text: four things you wanted to know

documents.title: headlines : new appeal over m54 body ; dana owner 's frustration after plans thrown out
text: these are the top stories in shropshire this morning :
- family of man whose body was discovered by the m54 issue fresh appeal for information
- dana prison owner disappointed by council 's rejection of plans
- shrewsbury town boss bemoans complexity of modern transfers
author: Alex Seftel
BBC Local Live

documents.title: telford woman claimed jobseekers allowance despite £ 44k inheritance from dad
text: a benefits cheat carried on claiming jobseekers allowance and housing benefit after inheriting £ 44,000 when her father died , a court heard .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: weather : storm barbara on the way
text: there 's a met office yellow warning for high winds in place for the west midlands .

documents.title: owner of dana `` disappointed '' by council decision
text: the owner of the dana prison site in shrewsbury says he 's `` disappointed '' with shropshire council 's decision to reject his redevelopment plans .
trevor osbourne wants to turn the site into homes , a gym and a restaurant but concerns over traffic and parking have been raised .
the 18th century , grade ii listed prison closed three years ago .
this was a negative result but without any suggestion about what might be preferred .
perhaps it might imply that local residents would rather just see the building remain empty .
perhaps even be lost . ''
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: headlines : back to the drawing board for dana prison , calls for loneliness to be tackled
text: here are some of the stories we 're looking at this morning :
- it could be back to the drawing board as plans to redevelop the old dana prison in shrewsbury have been refused
- loneliness should be recognised as a major public health issue according to the organisation that represents councils
- shrewsbury town 's paul hurst bemoans complexity of modern transfers
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: m54 body : family want answers into the death of missing father
text: the family of a black country man who disappeared eight years ago have issued a fresh plea for information .
surjit takhar , 37 , was last seen at his home in oldbury in october 2008 but his remains were found 18 months ago next to the m54 near telford .
police identified him using his dental records but they still do n't know how he died .
we need answers .
we need a funeral .
we need to say goodbye properly .
we just want to say goodbye and lay him to rest .

documents.title: weather : a cloudy start to the day
text: it 'll be cloudy and dry first thing .
this afternoon a band of wet and windy weather will be heading south eastwards .
this could cause some tricky driving conditions .
highs of 11c ( 52f ) .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning from bbc local live in shropshire
text: hello .
we 're in the bbc shropshire newsroom to bring you the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet or comment on our facebook page .
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: anxious christmas for missing farmer family
text: anxious christmas for missing farmer family

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: watch : this evening 's weather forecast
text: it looks set to be particularly windy over the next couple of days .
maximum temperature tonight is 8c ( 46f ) .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Weather Presenter

documents.title: pictures : shropshire dogs enjoy christmas dinner
text: dogs have been treated to a christmas dinner this afternoon at finding furever homes kennels near condover .
as you can see , they 've got their noses stuck into their food , and received gifts too !
author: Elaine Muir
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: plans to redevelop shrewsbury 's dana prison refused
text: plans for the transformation of shrewsbury 's historic dana prison have today been refused .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: yellow weather warning for high winds
text: there 's a yellow weather warning for high winds across the west midlands tomorrow issued by the met office .
wind could reach speeds of 50-60mph , with gusts of 70mph in places , between 12:00 and 18:00 on friday .
there could also be a short period of .
`` heavy rainfall '' , the met office is also warning .

documents.title: headlines : dana plans rejected ; caution over broadband cash announcement
text: as we head into the evening , these are the top stories for shropshire :
- shropshire planners unanimously refuse plans to redevelop shrewsbury 's dana
- clun councillor asks for more information after government announces rural broadband investment
- lilleshall-based gb archery team considering appeal over funding
author: Alex Seftel
BBC Local Live

documents.title: shropshire-based gb archery team considers appeal against funding cuts
text: the british archery team , which is based at lilleshall , could appeal against a decision to cut all of its olympic funding .
they 're one of five sports which have been told they will get no financial backing from uk sport over the next three years .
international archer naomi folkard says it 's a big blow , but believes the sport still has a positive future for youngsters aiming to reach the top .
we surpassed our uk sport goals then to be told that even though we 've done that , we 're losing all our funding is really disappointing . ''

documents.title: breakingdana redevelopment plans thrown out by councillors
text: plans to redevelop shrewsbury 's dana prison have been rejected unanimously following discussions at a planning committee .
trevor osborne wants to turn the former prison into new homes , shops , a gym and a restaurant - but concerns have remained over whether the narrow streets nearby are suited to the plans .
with objections raised about increased traffic and a lack of parking spaces - the planning committee decided that the proposals would over-develop the site .

documents.title: police officer dismissed for gross misconduct
text: a west mercia police officer has been dismissed `` with immediate effect '' forgross misconduct after wearing medals he was not entitled to at a funeral , the force says .
pc richard allen , 36 , had been with the force for 11 years and was most recently based in kidderminster .
a disciplinary hearing found he had `` breached the standards of professional behaviour in the areas of honesty and integrity '' by :
- wearing medals that he was not entitled to wear at a funeral
- giving a dishonest account regarding the wearing of the medals
- failing to report an unmanageable debt
- giving a dishonest account regarding his unmanageable debt
the family of 42-year-old pc richard allen , who also works in kidderminster , but lives in worcester , would like to point out he is not the officer who has been dismissed .

documents.title: shrewsbury town hope to have players back in time for boxing day
text: striker aj leitch-smith is still out for shrewsbury town , but there 's better news on the injury front for joe riley and sean whalley ( below ) .

both came off the bench in last week 's 2-0 win over bristol rovers , and whilst their being ready for a full 90 minutes remains to be seen , they 're in manager paul hurst 's thoughts for the boxing day trip to bolton .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: shropshire urged to recycle as much christmas waste as possible
text: unsurprisingly , this time of year produces lots of household waste .

the contractors responsible for dealing with this in shropshire , veolia , want to make sure we recycle as much of it as possible , including wrapping paper , cardboard boxes , plastic trays and batteries .
they 've put up these christmas decorations as examples to show that there 's very little which ca n't be recycled .
for more information on this , as well any changes to kerbside collections over the festive period , visit this site for telford and wrekin , and this one for shropshire .

documents.title: broadband investment must go towards poorest areas says shropshire councillor
text: a shropshire councillor has asked for caution following the news that 600,000 homes and businesses in rural areas could be connected to superfast broadband .

the government says it 's found £ 440m to invest in the project - but shropshire councillor for clun nigel hartin says the money must be spent on reaching areas he describes as `` not spots '' , rather than beefing up areas that already have plenty of coverage .
he 's also called on bt and shropshire council to work together to put fibre broadband directly into homes .
whilst on the face of it this is good news , a good many people in shropshire will want to know where the money will be spent and how quickly . ''
author: Alex Seftel
BBC Local Live

documents.title: headlines : councillor cautious over broadband cash announcement ; shrewsbury 's dana decision expected
text: these are the main shropshire stories we are looking at in the newsroom this afternoon :
- shropshire councillor says government broadband investment must reach poorest areas
- planners could approve the redevelopment of shrewsbury 's dana prison this afternoon
- horse-riders object to proposals for a chicken farm in longden , west of shrewsbury
author: Tim Page
News Editor, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : ricky tomlinson makes family discovery as part of tv show
text: the actor ricky tomlinson has discovered he 's not the first member of his family to be involved in a battle over workers ' rights .
he features on bbc one 's who do you think you are ?
tonight .
the show discovered his ancestors were hard-pressed dock workers - one of whom was crushed by a cart .
the actor was jailed in the 70s for conspiracy for violence during building workers ' protests in shrewsbury .

documents.title: oswestry man criticises m & s request for id verification
text: a man from oswestry says he 's thinking of cutting-up his marks and spencer credit card , because of the hoops he 's having to go through to prove his wife 's identity .
john powell has had the card , which has his wife registered as a second user , for 15 years .
he has offered to send copies of her driving licence and household bills , but was asked to go 33 miles to the nearest branch with suitable finance facilities at cheshire oaks .
marks and spencer say they 're trying to update their records and protect customers from being victims of crime .
why they should need to identify my wife at this late stage , i just can not imagine . ''

documents.title: trains affected by christmas work at shrewsbury
text: a handful of train services will be affected by work on the railway line over christmas .
network rail is replacing sleepers on the line at shrewsbury station and it will have an impact on trains running after 22:00 on christmas eve and before 06:00 on 27 december .
there are no trains scheduled to run on christmas day or boxing day .

documents.title: defender finds new club five months after leaving shrewsbury town
text: former shrewsbury town defender jermaine grandison has signed for colchester united - five months after leaving shrewsbury in the summer .
the 26-year-old , who made 175 appearances for the shrews , had previously been on trial at other clubs , but was n't offered a contract .
# colu are pleased to welcome defender jermaine grandison to the club , as he signs after impressing on trial :
congratulations to @ twitterid on signing for @ twitterid # salop
best of luck jermaine you deserve some great christmas present
great signing , i still miss him at salop .
good luck grando
best of luck jermaine utter legend at salop .
i will never forget the stepovers and the superb goal at notts county .
great signing for you guys , if he stays fit then you 've got a great defender for this level !
well done jermaine
great signing .
cult hero at shrews your fans will love him
@ twitterid
cracking signing that
author: Stuart Dunn
Shrewsbury Town commentator, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: shropshire gritters 'ready for whatever winter throws at them '
text: shropshire council 's gritting teams will be keeping a close eye on the weather during the festive break .
crews will be on call throughout the holidays in case conditions turn icy , but salt stocks are high and they 're confident they can cope with anything the weather throws at them .
we 're well prepared , we 've always prided ourselves on being able to get out there and do whatever is necessary . ''
author: Ian Perry
Reporter, BBC Radio Shropshire

documents.title: oswestry man asked to drive 33 miles to verify credit card
text: an oswestry man has criticised marks and spencer bank for what he thinks are `` heavy-handed '' demands to prove his wife 's identity .

john powell has had an m & s credit card for 15 years , but he 's now been asked to travel 33 miles with his wife 's id documents , to prove her as the second user on the card , years after they joined up .
he says he was asked to have her passport and household bills verified by staff at his nearest branch with suitable finance facilities , which is 33 miles away at cheshire oaks .
m & s bank says it 's taking these actions in order to update their records and to protect customers from financial crime .

documents.title: latest : congestion fears might not stop dana redvelopment ; long credit card journey ; calls to recycle christmas waste
text: here are the main stories we are working on this lunchtime :
- shropshire planners suggest concerns about traffic are n't a good enough reason to block redevelopment plans for shrewsbury 's old prison
- oswestry man calls a supermarket `` heavy handed '' after being asked to drive 33 miles ( 53km ) to verify a credit card
- shropshire waste bosses insist that `` around 95 % '' of the county 's christmas waste is recyclable
author: Alex Seftel
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : the new saints training this morning
text: this weekend , the new saints of oswestry could equal a world record for the number of consecutive wins in a row in all competitions by a top tier league club .
they 've been putting the work in at park hall this morning , and you can watch them training here .

documents.title: watch : sunshine and showers this afternoon
text: plenty of sunshine around this afternoon , but also a chanceof the odd shower .
highs of 9c ( 48f ) .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: bridgnorth cottage with cave is an online smash
text: a bridgnorth cottage which has its very own cave was one of the most-viewed properties online in 2016 .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: shropshire could benefit from £ 440m rural broadband investment
text: the government says it 's found £ 440m to bring faster internet to areas that do n't have it .
it should mean another 600,000 homes will gain access to superfast broadband .
the cash comes from `` efficiency savings '' and money returned by bt as part of a previous scheme .
ministers are promising that 95 % of homes will have access to speedier broadband by this time next year .

documents.title: goose farmer remembers schoolboy roots
text: one of shropshire 's leading christmas goose-breeders says he got into the market by chance .
william brisbourne from nesscliffe bought a few geese as a schoolboy and now each year his farm sells hundreds for the christmas dinner tables around the country .
i bought a goose with five goslings for the princely sum of £ 5 it became apparent that there 's a bit of money to be made at christmas we 're now doing about 1,700 geese . ''

documents.title: town chairman predicts 'busy ' transfer window
text: shrewsbury town 's chairman roland wycherley says the club has been aware of many of paul hurst 's transfer targets since appointing him as manager in october , and will back him during next month 's transfer window .

we always agreed that if we could get to january without being too far adrift , he would obviously want to bring in some of the players he likes - which from what we spoke about will be to our liking and the fans ' liking , i 'm sure . ''
after two successive wins , town could move out of the league one relegation zone with a good result at bolton on boxing day .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: shropshire man who shot himself dead in police stand-off is named
text: a man who shot himself after hours in a stand-off with police has been named .
james massey , 35 , of hungerford , near craven arms died on december 10 .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: prison plans 'good example of overdevelopment '
text: the councillor in whose area shrewsbury prison sits says the plans for its future use would put too much on the site .
labour 's alan moseley represents castlefields on the shropshire and shrewsbury town councils .
he agrees the prison has to be put to good use , but feels that plans before councillors today will put too much pressure on surrounding narrow streets .
the osborne group wants to us the site for student accommodation , apartments , restaurants and offices .
it 's difficult for residents ' parking in castlefields as it is .
this will make it so much worse . ''

documents.title: headlines : rural broadband gets £ 440m ; fears of 'overdevelopment ' at shrewsbury 's former dana prison
text: these are the top stories for shropshire this morning :
- shropshire could benefit from £ 440m government investment in rural broadband
- plans to build homes and shops at shrewsbury 's dana prison described as `` overdevelopment '' ahead of planning meeting
- shrewsbury town expecting busy transfer window to fight off relegation from league one
author: Alex Seftel
BBC Local Live

documents.title: concerns over eye treatment changes
text: groups representing nhs patients in shropshire have expressed concern about changes to eye treatment .
the shrewsbury and telford hospitals ' trust announced yesterday that no new referrals would be accepted for the first part of next year for a range of conditions , including glaucoma .
it 's to enable it to deal with a backlog of cases which have already been referred .
the chief executive of the patients ' group healthwatch shropshire says it 's good news for those people already on the waiting list , who should get treated more quickly .
but jane randall-smith says she 's concerned about where those who are yet to join the referral list will be treated instead .
health commissioners say it 'll be outside the county , but have n't been specific .

documents.title: your photos : sunrise over aston and hopton heath
text: storm barbara may be heading this way , but bbc weather watchers brian j and hopton karen were up early to catch some great sunrises in aston and hopton heath .
i 'd love to feature your photos on this page - you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid message via facebook .

documents.title: wrong-way m54 lorry driver given three-year ban
text: a lorry driver has been given a suspended sentence after a motorist had to stop him from driving the wrong way down the m54 .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: prison plan up for discussion
text: there 's a warning that concerns about traffic are n't a good enough reason to block redevelopment plans for shrewsbury 's old prison .
shropshire council 's planning committee is meeting later today to consider the proposals to turn the site into student accommodation , apartments , offices , a gym and restaurants .
a report says the extra traffic and demand for parking , which would be generated , might not stand up as a reason to reject the plans if they go to appeal .
author: Tim Page
News Editor, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: travel : crash on a464 near shifnal
text: there are reports of an accident in telford on the a464 around j4 of the m54 ( shifnal ) .
get the latest information on bbc travel .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: latest : £ 440m for rural broadband ; dana prison revamp goes before council planners ; concerns over eye patients
text: here are some of the stories we 're looking at this morning :
- the government says an extra £ 440m is to be invested in bringing fast broadband connections to rural areas
- plans to redevelop shrewsbury 's dana prison could get the go-ahead by shropshire council today
- concerns are expressed after the nhs decided to stop treating some new eye patients in shropshire for at least six months

documents.title: watch : latest weather forecast
text: it will be a mainly dry and bright day with a light south-westerly wind .
there will be plenty of sunshine , but also a chanceof the odd shower .
maximum temperature : 9c ( 48f ) .

documents.title: good morning - welcome to our live updates for the day
text: welcome to live updates from bbc shropshire on thursday morning .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid message via facebook .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: weather : clear and cold for shropshire tonight
text: it 's going to be a clear and cold night for most of us tonight , with temperatures staying just above freezing .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: views wanted on river severn scheme
text: your views are still wanted on what the environment agency is describing as the `` largest river restoration project of its kind in europe '' .
the unlocking the severn scheme aims to open the river severn and its tributaries to fish and other wildlife , as well increase the economy connected with it .
the plan is to introduce fish passes and remove weirs .

documents.title: over 1,000 eye patients could be affected by referrals decision
text: it 's estimated about 200 eye patients a month could be affected by the decision to stop some referrals to the hospitals in shrewsbury and telford .
those patients will probably have to travel out of the county until services are restored in late summer next year .

the shrewsbury and telford hospital trust says it was not a decision taken lightly and existing patients would continue to get treatment while the backlog of cases which forced the decision is cleared .

documents.title: first phase of bridgnorth station project complete
text: the first phase of work on the redevelopment of bridgnorth station is complete - the installation of 63 concrete-filled metal tubes which will support the new refreshment-block .

the workmen are now installing the services and drainage which run underneath the building and most of them will take a short break over christmas , before returning in the new year to complete that job and then start laying the floor slabs in late-january .

the project is scheduled to take 34 weeks , if the weather stays dry and mild this winter and once the new building is complete , the station pub will temporarily move into the new block , so that alterations can be made to the existing building .
if all goes to plan , the building work should be complete by the summer .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: hospitals to stop receiving some eye-conditions
text: the hospitals in shrewsbury and telford have decided to stop taking new referrals for a number of eye conditions , including glaucoma , adult squints and an area they describe as `` non-specialised ophthalmology '' .

the opthalmology department , which treats eye conditions , says it has long been struggling to treat as many patients as there are on its waiting lists and also has what it describes as `` workforce pressures '' .
it is expected to take at least six months to clear the backlog and it could mean patients travelling out of the county to be seen .

documents.title: headlines : eye treatment referrals on hold ; schools merger approved ; concerns over adult social care funding
text: our headlines this evening :
- hospitals to stop receiving some eye patients
- merger of three schools approved
- council raises concerns over adult social care funding plans
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: in work on railway station improvements well underway
text: workmen have been busy over the past few weeks , sinking piles into the ground next to the severn valley railway 's bridgnorth station .
the railway says 63 of them have been installed now .
work is also taking place to prepare the drainage for the new refreshment block , part of a £ 5m redevelopment of the railway station , which is being half-funded by a share-issue .

documents.title: councillors approve merger of three schools
text: shropshire councillors have approved the merger of three village schools .
the children from st mary 's primary school , hope primary school and worthen primary school will now all be educated together on an enlarged site at worthen ( below ) .

documents.title: thomas cook defends its handling of pilot case
text: thomas cook is insisting its dispute with the ellesmere pilot mike simkins was about `` his conduct '' and that `` at no point was captain simkins expected to fly while fatigued '' .
however , the company says that it has accepted the findings of an employment tribunal and apologised to mr simkins for the `` hurt and distress '' caused by his suspension .
the tribunal reported mr simkins was suspended after refusing to fly a plane he was rostered to pilot , saying he was tired after flying long hours the previous day .

the case has prompted the british airline pilots association to raise wider concerns about its members ' workload , but thomas cook has responded by saying it has `` robust processes to ensure all the legal limits on flying time are met '' .

documents.title: your photos : muddy footpaths around the county
text: it must be a day for people to get their walking boots on , because we 've had a few photos of muddy footpaths from the bbc weather watchers today .
these ones were taken near newport ( top ) and ludlow ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: travel : two more accidents affecting traffic in shropshire
text: there 's been a two-car accident on lancaster road which is affecting traffic in both directions in shrewsbury between the harlescott lane junction and the mount pleasant road junction .
and there 's been another accident on the a518 in trench at hortonwood roundabout .
motorists are being advised to approach that one with care .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: travel : a5 blocked at gobowen by accident
text: the a5 in gobowen is partially blocked and there is slow traffic in both directions near south gobowen , because of an accident and recovery work .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: council says adult care will be worse off under new funding plans
text: new government funding proposals which are meant to give councils more money to spend on adult social care , will leave shropshire council worse off , the leader of the authority has claimed .

the leader of the authority , councillor malcolm pate , says he has written to the secretary of state for communities and local government , to argue that despite having a growing elderly population , the county is getting a lower than average amount of funding .

the government announced last week that councils would be allowed to put up council taxes by up to 3 % to help fund adult social care , but mr pate says in his letter that this will make little difference and he has invited sajid javid to pay a visit .

documents.title: headlines : council 's adult social care funding ; thomas cook responds to pilot case ; anti-social behaviour laws tightened
text: here 's a recap of our headlines this afternoon :
- council says adult social care will be worse off under new government funding plans
- thomas cook defends its handling of ellesmere pilot case
- anti-social behaviour rules in shrewsbury to be tightened
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : shrewsbury players encouraged to mingle
text: shrewsbury town are encouraging their players to wander around the town and mingle with the christmas crowds this year .
defender jack grimmer likes the idea saying he has settled into shrewsbury and that there is a relaxed feeling around the town .
shrewsbury have n't got a game until boxing day , when they travel to bolton .
from time to time you get asked for the odd photo or you see the odd fan and have a chat with them , which is always nice . ''

documents.title: fears that more shropshire bus routes could be axed in new strategy
text: more rural routes could be axed as part of a new bus strategy for shropshire , campaigners have warned .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: police warning over roads access
text: there have been complaints about people parking on two roads in st martins which are meant to be for residents only .
kimberley lane and clark 's lane are designated access only , but the police say drivers have been using them as a short-cut .

the police have explained that these roads were n't built to cope with large volumes of traffic and kimberley lane does n't have a pavement , so it is asking motorists to avoid them , to protect pedestrians .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: book to celebrate 150th anniversary of methodist church
text: hadley methodist church is 150 years old this year and a book 's been published , documenting its history .
the author is terry gilder , a former editor of the newport and market drayton advertiser , who says it 's a `` warts and all '' telling of the story .
stories include the benefactor who misused the church for a political rally , to a celebration of the hugely popular sunday school which at one time had 200 children .

documents.title: anti-social behaviour rules could be tightened
text: rules on anti-social behaviour in shrewsbury town centre could be tightened .
under the proposals going before shropshire councillors , you could get a £ 100 fine for things like leaving personal belongings lying around , drinking outdoors , or using the streets as a toilet .
but the council 's cabinet will hear this afternoon that it would be inappropriate to banish rough sleepers , as has happened in some other areas .
author: Andrew Hewkin
Newsreader, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: whitchurch herald front page : victim 's family speak out as death crash driver is jailed
text: the family of a whitchurch mother who lost her life in a car accident have told the herald she will always be with them at this special time of year .
author: Whitchurch Herald

documents.title: limekiln roundabout work part of wider project
text: the work to widen telford 's limekiln roundabout and add a pedestrian crossing started back in march and is part of a wider £ 13.9m project to upgrade six roundabouts in the area .
the majority of the money is coming through the marches local enterprise partnership and the plan was to have all the work complete by march next year .
the other five roundabouts being worked on are the shawbirch roundabout , the limekiln roundabout , the clock tower roundabout , the trench lock roundabout and the ketley brook roundabout .
the installation of traffic lights on the randlay interchange is also part of the project .

documents.title: headlines : telford roundabout work complete ; ellesmere case 'raises airline issues ' ; biggest meeting for racecourse
text: our headlines this lunchtime :
- work on telford roundabout complete after nine-month project
- union says case of ellesmere pilot raises serious industry issues
- ludlow racecourse holding its biggest race-meeting of the year
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: your photos : more of cloudy skies from around shropshire
text: we 've had some brilliant sunrise and sunset shared by the bbc weather watchers over the past few days and here we have another great photo of the winter solstice dawn - this one taken near ludlow .
and this photo was taken in oswestry yesterday evening .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: weather : rain this lunchtime and a cloudy afternoon
text: there 's a chance of some rain this lunchtime , then it will remain cloudy through the afternoon , before the skies clear overnight .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: travel : broken-down lorry causing delays on a53
text: the a53 at ternhill partially blocked and there is slow traffic westbound at the a41 junction , because of a broken-down lorry .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: travel : limekiln junction clear of roadworks
text: it looks as though nine months of roadworks at a busy telford roundabout have finally come to an end .
there have been delays at the limekiln junction in priorslee since march .
telford & wrekin council has blamed severn trent water for the delays in work , calling the company `` incompetent '' and demanding compensation .
severn trent say it wants to `` sit down with the council '' to discuss the issue so lessons can be learnt .
people living nearby say restrictions were finally lifted early this morning .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: plans for ellesmere hotel , marina and 250 homes approved
text: a major 250-home and leisure development which could attract more than 1,200 extra people to ellesmere and create up to 180 jobs in the town has been given the go-ahead .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: schools merger plan set to get council cabinet backing
text: the official merger of three village schools is expected to move a step closer today .
under the proposals the schools at hope and westbury will shut and pupils will travel to an enlarged site at worthen .
between them , the schools have lost almost a quarter of their pupils this year and are struggling to recruit staff .
shropshire council 's cabinet will recommend the official merger when it meets later .
i talk to parents because i was willing to fight this and actually what they said was 'there are not enough of us ' . ''
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: union says ellesmere pilot 's case highlights industry problem
text: the case of an ellesmere airline pilot who was suspended for refusing to fly a plane whilst tired highlights a wider industry problem , his union says .
dr rob hunter from the british airline pilots ' association ( below ) said the rules on flying hours were too flexible at the moment and allowed airlines to create `` very fatiguing rosters '' .

dr hunter said his union has a `` substantial full-time team '' looking at the issue of tiredness and said that because air travel was a `` highly competitive environment '' , airlines can face a conflict of interest `` and pressurise pilots to fly '' .
mike simkins from ellesmere won undisclosed compensation after an employment tribunal found he 'd been unfairly treated by thomas cook airlines .
there are better ways of defining how tired is too tired .
and one of the aching faults of the regulation is that definition is n't there .
so what effectively happens is airlines are left to themselves to decide what that looks like . ''

documents.title: headlines : pilot case 'highlights wider issues ' ; school merger discussed ; ludlow hosts big race meeting
text: our headlines this morning :
- case of ellesmere airline pilot highlights serious industry problems says union
- councilllors to discuss merger of three schools
- ludlow racecourse hosts biggest meeting of the year
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: concerns raised over working hours after pilot wins compensation
text: the british airline pilots association says a growing number of its members are worried about long working hours and safety after a shropshire-based pilot was punished after he rang bosses to say he was too tired to fly a boeing 767 .
mike simkins , who lives near ellesmere has won undisclosed compensation at an employment tribunal after he was suspended for six months and threatened with the sack by thomas cook airlines .
an employment tribunal ruled he was perfectly within his rights to do so after hearing that he 'd had three early starts in a row including an 18-hour day .
author: Andrew Hewkin
Newsreader, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: merging shropshire 's councils 'could save £ 20m a year '
text: shrewsbury mp daniel kawczynski has written to sajid javid , secretary of state for communities and local government , saying he believes shropshire council and telford & wrekin council should be combined .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: ludlow racecourse stages richest ever meeting
text: ludlow racecourse stages its biggest meeting of the year today and this year it 's the richest ever held at the course .
the feature race of the day at 1:35 is the tanners wines handicap chase worth over £ 17,000 to the winner and it 's attracted a quality field of runners .
there are seven races in all , with the first at 12:35
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: headlines : pilot wins pay out after suspension ; schools merger recommended
text: this morning :
- ellesmere pilot wins compensation amid worries about safety
- shropshire council 's cabinet to recommend a plan to merge three schools
- ludlow racecourse holds biggest meeting of the year
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : latest weather for shropshire
text: a cloudy and breezy start to the day with a small amount of drizzle , a few brighter intervals will develop ahead of a band of rain through the early afternoon .
maximum temperature 10c ( 50f ) .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: welcome to bbc local live in shropshire
text: good morning .
we 're in the bbc shropshire newsroom to let you know the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet or comment on our facebook page .
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: accountant jailed for £ 315,000 theft
text: accountant jailed for £ 315,000 theft

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: cash for two wildlife projects
text: the waste company veolia is giving the severn rivers trust almost £ 50,000 to protect the river worfe through bridgnorth .

the money will be used to make the river a more suitable habitat for several species , including brown trout , salmon , eels , white clawed crayfish , otters , water voles , and a wide range of bugs .
the company is also giving £ 28,000 to the shropshire wildlife trust to create an educational play area at its headquarters in shrewsbury ( above ) .

documents.title: watch : another cloudy night for shropshire
text: it 's going to be another cloudy night in shropshire , with temperatures dropping to around 7c ( 45f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: decision not to challenge ludlow homes ruling explained by council
text: shropshire council says it wo n't be challenging a planning inspector 's decision to allow 137 homes to be built in ludlow , even though it thinks he made a number of `` clear errors '' in coming to his decision .
it says that only a small number of appeals made to the high court are successful and that even if it won , the applicants might return to make another attempt in the new year .
the authority says that by allowing this application to go ahead , it will make it harder for developers to justify future housing schemes around the town .
the decision not to pursue this case has been criticised by ludlow councillor andy boddington , who said shropshire council had let the town down .

documents.title: unlocking the severn : take part in public consultation
text: members of the public are being asked to take part in a consultation as part of a major project to restore the river severn .

the £ 19.4m project , which is the largest of its kind ever attempted in europe , was developed jointly by the severn rivers trust , the canal and river trust , the environment agency and natural england .
your views are important !
have your say on a major project which will open up the river severn for people & wildlife

documents.title: shrewsbury mp interested in high speed 'hyperloop ' travel
text: it sounds like science fiction , but the shrewsbury mp would like britain to explore the possibility of people travelling around in pod-like vehicles which travel at speeds of hundreds of miles an hour inside enclosed tubes .
the department for transport has confirmed to daniel kawczynski that it is looking at the potential of so-called hyperloop technology and a report is due to be published early next year .
mr kawczynski called the response `` encouraging '' adding that `` britain must do all it can to create an environment where future technologies can thrive '' .
whether it be driverless cars , hydrogen fuel cells or hyperloop we have to be telling the world to make it here because britain is at the heart of innovation . ''

documents.title: latest : health secretary to discuss hospital plans ; christmas arrests increase ; funding for river project
text: our top stories this evening :
- health secretary to meet mps over hospital reorganisation proposals
- increase in arrests over christmas party weekend
- funding to protect wildlife on river worfe
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: increase in arrests over christmas party weekend
text: the police are reporting an increase the number of people they arrested over the weekend just gone , traditionally one of their busiest periods of the year .

west mercia are putting extra officers on the streets , to cope with drink-related trouble during the christmas party season , and say that across the force area , the number of people arrested and taken into a custody suite went up by 10 % , compared to the previous weekend .
in shropshire the rise was even higher - up 40 % .
herefordshire and worcestershire saw little change in the numbers .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: health secretary wants to meet mps over hospital proposals
text: the health secretary says he wants to meet shropshire mps to `` bring to a close '' the ongoing uncertainty over the county 's hospitals .
plans to create on emergency care department in shrewsbury and downgrade telford 's a & e have been held up , after failing to win the support of local health commissioners .
responding to a question by the telford mp , lucy allan , jeremy hunt said the process had taken `` much too long '' .

documents.title: your photos : swan photographed near newport
text: we 're always happy to feature the photos you take when you 're out and about in the county and this one was taken near newport earlier by one of the bbc weather watchers .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: travel : accident closes road in ruyton xi towns
text: church street in ruyton-xi-towns blocked and there is slow traffic in both directions near the little ness road junction , because of an accident .
the fire service are reporting one person being trapped .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: tills ring out on shropshire 's high streets in lead up to christmas
text: in a year in which we lost bhs , marks and spencer continued to struggle to steady the ship , and the internet grew ever mightier , retailers could be forgiven for feeling the pressure .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: interest in converting phone-boxes
text: there 's been interest in converting a number of out-of-use phone boxes in the county .

bt is consulting on plans to close 214 across the shropshire council area and the authority says it 's heard from 20 town or parish councils which have expressed an interest in putting them to other uses .
the council is due to submit its initial response to the proposals this week and says there has been no comment from people living near 66 of the phone boxes .
bt says it wo n't switch off a phone box if people want to keep it in use .

documents.title: latest : christmas arrests up ; market responds to complaint ; interest in converting phone boxes
text: our headlines this afternoon :
- arrests up over christmas party weekend
- christmas market gives advice to stall-holders after pricing complaint
- interest in converting several shropshire phone boxes once they are taken out of use
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : metal detectorist delighted with ring-find
text: a shropshire metal detector enthusiast says the gold ring he found in a field near oswestry is a `` find of a lifetime '' for him .
will barker made the discovery last week and posted photos online .
opinions are varying over the age of the ring , but take a look for yourself .

documents.title: bridgnorth home among 'most clicked ' in country
text: a bridgnorth home with a vaulted cellar was among the for-sale properties most clicked-on this year , according to the website rightmove .
others include a fortress on the market for £ 550,000 and a £ 55m house in london 's belgravia .
the house in bridgnorth used to belong to artist antony dracup and was put up for sale in january .

documents.title: markets closed in german capital
text: our reporter steve humbles has been walking around berlin this lunchtime , noticing the flags flying at half-mast around the city , following last night 's terror attack .
he has also been to visit a number of other christmas markets around the town , which are closed today .
another market in centre of # berlin closed out of solidarity with yesterday 's victims .
heavy police presence in background .

documents.title: christmas market organisers act after complaint
text: the organisers of telford 's christmas market say they 've taken action to ensure you know how much you 're paying .
it follows complaints on facebook that one trader was n't displaying prices and charging more than customers were expecting .
organisers say the stall is now displaying prices , but that these are independent traders who can set their own prices .
author: Tim Page
News Editor, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: telford drug gang leader jailed
text: a vietnamese man who controlled a work force of illegal immigrants as gardeners '' to cultivate cannabis in towns across the country , including telford , has been jailed .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: latest : extra £ 3m for people with learning difficulties ; man hurt in crash ; market acts after pricing complaint
text: these are our top stories this lunchtime :
- extra £ 3m to help people with learning difficulties in the county
- man hurt in two-car crash
- telford christmas market organisers act over pricing complaint
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: overnight closures for telford town centre road
text: rampart way in telford is going to be closed tomorrow night and the following night to allow workmen to re-paint road markings .
it 's part of a £ 12.3m project to turn rampart way and hall park way into dual carriageways and to replace the footbridge to the railway station .
the road between the forge island and hollinswood will close at 22:00 tomorrow and reopen at 06:00 on thursday morning .
telford and wrekin council says it is hoping the job can be done in one night , but if the weather is bad it could take two .

documents.title: telford man sends back photos from quiet berlin
text: radio shropshire 's steve humbles has arrived in berlin to start a holiday , the morning after the terrorist attack on a christmas market there .
he has been around the stalls in alexanderplatz this morning .
shutters up at the alexanderplatz christmas market in # berlin .
nearly all stalls closed today .
eerie atmosphere .
is it closed today ?
i wanted to visit the market at alexa today
yes .
barring the very odd stall , essentially it 's closed - as are all the markets across berlin .
unsure if reopening tomorrow .
hopefully they 'll open them asap , we ca n't stop living , that 's what they want us to do cheers

documents.title: oswestry advertizer front page : crowds gather for funeral which community made happen
text: the former sainsbury 's worker ernie matthews was laid to rest yesterday - and the people of oswestry turned out in force .
author: Oswestry & Border Counties Advertizer

documents.title: watch : cloudy today and the chance of some rain later
text: it will remain cloudy this afternoon and there is the chance of a shower this evening .
it 's going to be a bit colder too , with temperatures not rising much beyond 6c ( 43f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: your photos : sheep on an overcast winters day
text: we 're seeing plenty of wintery scenes from the bbc weather watchers today and it 's been an overcast morning around the county it seems .
this photo of sheep in a field was taken near newport a little bit earlier today .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: festive changes to bin collections
text: with the christmas holidays approaching , there will be some changes to your bin collection days .

for most people it will just mean your rubbish is collected a day later than usual , but people who were due to have their bins collected on boxing day , will have to put them out on christmas eve instead .
author: Andrew Hewkin
Newsreader, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: man hurt in two-car crash
text: a man has been injured in a two-car crash on the telford to dudley road this morning .
it happened near the royal oak at rudge heath .
firefighters cut him free from the wreckage and he was taken to hospital .
author: Andrew Hewkin
Newsreader, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: calls to delay shrewsbury 's dana prison redevelopment decision
text: a residents ' group has pleaded with members of shropshire council 's planning committee to stall on making a decision about the redevelopment of shrewsbury 's dana prison .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: severn valley railway sells another 100,000 shares
text: since the start of december , the severn valley railway has sold more than 100,000 shares , bringing the total to 636,000 .
it is hoping to sell 2.5m in a year , to raise money for the redevelopment of its bridgnorth station .
workmen have already been on site sinking foundations and the railway says there will be more activity early in the new year .

documents.title: latest : extra £ 3m for people with learning difficulties ; gold ring found ; shrewsbury town player search
text: our headlines this morning :
- an extra £ 3m to help people with learning difficulties
- gold ring found by oswestry metal detectorist
- shrewsbury town boss looks for new recruits
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: ring found in oswestry could be roman
text: a shropshire metal detector has found a gold ring which could date back to roman times .
will barker made the discovery near oswestry last week and an inquest will be held in the new year to determine more about the ring 's origins .
it could end up in a museum .
it was at the end of a day , i was completely demoralised , freezing cold , [ using the ] last 15 minutes of light [ and ] we were basically turning back towards the car .
it was , i 'd say , 10cm down . ''
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : town 's boss looking for 'athleticism ' and 'pace '
text: paul hurst wants to add `` athleticism '' and `` pace '' to his shrewsbury town team in the january transfer window .
the town manager wants several new recruits to help their fight against relegation in league one .
hurst says he 's dealing with agents putting forward plenty of names .
you know what 's on their christmas list , all their players moving and making them some money .
a lot of the names i 've been thrown are not to our liking . ''
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: funding to help people with learning disabilities given to councils
text: nearly £ 3m is to be given to shropshire 's two main councils to help disabled people live more independently .
shropshire council will get almost £ 2.5m , with telford and wrekin set to receive just over £ 500,000 .
it 's part of a national scheme run by the department of health to provide more homes and equipment for people with learning disabilities .
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : a cloudy start to the day
text: it 'll be another misty and cloudy morning but there will be periods of sunshine this afternoon .
highs of 6c ( 43f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: latest : extra funding for people with learning difficulties ; ring found that could be roman ; signings promise
text: some of the main stories in shropshire this morning :
- £ 3m allocated to helping people with learning difficulties
- a ring that could date back to roman times has been found in oswestry
- shrewsbury town 's manager insists he wo n't make signings for the sake of it
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: welcome to bbc local live for shropshire
text: good morning from bbc local live for shropshire .
we 're in the bbc shropshire newsroom to bring you the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet or comment on our facebook page .
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: on midlands today from 18:30 : prison riot , factory closure and teen darts
text: on midlands today this evening we 'll be looking at the aftermath of the riots on friday at hmp birmingham .
we 'll also be at one of the region 's main employers which is finally closing this week .
and you 'll meet a teenage darts player from stoke-on-trent who has faced some of the greats after just a year on the competition circuit .
those stories and more from 18:30 on bbc one .
author: Mary Rhodes
Presenter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: weather : cloudy this evening with some rain overnight
text: it 's going to be a cloudy evening , with some rain in parts of the county overnight .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: charity takes over two day centres
text: two shropshire council day centres that teach skills to adults with learning difficulties have been taken over by the local charity bethphage .
oak farm in ditton priors teaches agricultural skills to nearly 50 people and innage lane in bridgnorth passes on craft-skills to around 20 people .
both sites operate five days a week and will keep their current names .

documents.title: no serious injuries after car overturns
text: this is a photo the police took of the car which overturned near crudgington earlier this afternoon .
the ambulance service says one man was assessed for minor injuries after managing to free himself from the vehicle and was n't taken to hospital .

documents.title: your photos : christmas lights in bridgnorth
text: here 's a photo of the bridgnorth christmas lights over the bridge in low town this evening .
it 's been shared by one of the bbc weather watchers .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: headlines : concern for shropshire council staff ; river project consultation ; tns look to equal wins-record
text: our headlines this evening :
- union concerned about stress affecting shropshire council workers
- views wanted on severn fish project
- the new saints close to equaling ajax win-record
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: oswestry care home resident celebrates 105th birthday
text: an oswestry care home resident has celebrated her 105th birthday with at a special celebration which spanned four generations .
author: Shropshire Live

documents.title: your views wanted on severn project
text: in the new year a £ 19.4m project gets under way on the river severn to make it easier for fish to reach their spawning grounds .
the work , to remove blockages is intended to help declining species like salmon and eels and to make the river a more attractive place to visit .
and the severn rivers trust is asking for your thoughts about the river and the way it is used at the moment .
want to get involved in the exciting £ 19m unlocking the severn project ?
please start by completing this survey .

documents.title: travel : accident partially closes crudgington to cherrington road
text: there 's been an accident on the b5062 between crudgington and cherrington and the road is partially blocked .
rtc on b5062 between crudgington & cherrington road partially blocked 999 crews on scene - expect delays !
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: bin collection dates altered over christmas
text: with the christmas holidays approaching , there will be some changes to your bin collection days .
important if you want to get rid of all that wrapping paper and plastic packaging .

for most people it will just mean your rubbish is collected a day later than usual , but in both the telford and wrekin and shropshire council areas people who were due to have their bins collected on boxing day , will have to put them out on christmas eve instead .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: bid to reopen oswestry street to traffic and help revive town trade
text: plans to reopen a town centre street blighted by empty shops to traffic will be discussed in the new year , the deputy leader of shropshire council has said .
author: Oswestry and Borders Chronicle

documents.title: weather : cloudy and mild weather forecast for christmas day
text: it 's now under a week until christmas day and if we look at the longer-range weather forecasts , we 're expecting it to be cloudy and mild in shropshire .
there 's a chance there could be some rain in the west of the county , around oswestry .
we 'll bring you a more accurate forecast nearer the time , but at this stage snow is looking very , very unlikely .

documents.title: headlines : unison stress warning ; chicken farm opposition ; tns look for wins record
text: here 's a recap of our top stories this afternoon :
- unison says some staff appear close to `` nervous breakdown '' because of over-work
- opposition to two chicken farms
- tns look to equal world wins record
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : the new saints approach wins record
text: the new saints are now one win away from equaling ajax 's world record for top-flight consecutive wins across all competitions ( including the scottish irn bru cup ) .
that record stands at 25 and tns can reach that landmark with victory over cefn druids on boxing day .
they are still some way short of the record for consecutive league wins though .
celtic recorded 25 league victories in a row in 2003-4 and the european benchmark stands at 29 .
there are also clubs in lower divisions which claim longer winning runs across all competitions - including hereford fc , who won 27 in a row recently .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: action vowed over 'unfair ' council tax hitting services in church stretton
text: a town council has resolved to lobby the government after concerns about cuts reached a head .
author: South Shropshire Journal

documents.title: football club hosting carol service
text: fans are being encouraged to join shrewsbury town 's players and staff at a christmas carol service at the abbey this evening .
the doors open at 18:15 and the club says they will be celebrating the 200th anniversary of silent night

documents.title: ice hockey : hundreds of teddies collected at pirates game
text: the `` teddy toss '' at telford tigers match against hull pirates on saturday has been described as a `` wonderful sight '' by the woman who organised it , sam middleton .
fans were asked to throw the bears on to the ice when the first goal was scored and 310 were collected up .
they will now be delivered to young people at hope house and to the children 's ward at telford 's princess royal hospital .
it was such a wonderful sight to see so many teddy bears land on the ice after the first goal of the game .
preparations for the event have taken a couple of weeks , but the reaction of fans , from both telford and hull , has been wonderful .
it was nerve-wracking , but worth it in the end ! ''
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: shrewsbury 's copthorne barracks scheme to be discussed
text: councillors are to discuss how best to use £ 30,000 for play areas from developers behind plans to build houses at copthorne barracks .
author: Shrewsbury Chronicle

documents.title: on midlands today from 13:30 : factory facing final few days
text: on midlands today this lunchtime , i 'll be live at one of the region 's main employers , the goodyear tyre factory , which is finally closing this week .
the company made the announcement back in june and since then several hundred workers have been made redundant .
we 'll have more from bbc one from 13:30 .
author: Peter Plisner
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: long-running battle over ludlow development
text: plans for a housing development off foldgate lane in ludlow were submitted and refused planning permission over a year ago , but last month a government planning inspector ruled the scheme should go ahead .

after hearing evidence for four days in the summer , he agreed there would be a visual impact , but that it would be minimal and local and that it was n't enough to stop richborough estates from building the 137 homes .

ludlow town council and ludford parish council wrote to shropshire council urging it to appeal , arguing the development would completely undermine the local housing plan set up to determine housing need for the next 10 years and that it 's entirely unsuitable for the area .

documents.title: headlines : council worker stress warning ; chicken farms opposed ; ice hockey teddy collection
text: our headlines this lunchtime :
- unison warns of stress affecting shropshire council workers
- opposition to plans for two chicken farms
- hundreds of teddies collected by ice hockey club
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: union warns of stress on shropshire council workers
text: unison says it is being contacted on a daily basis by members at shropshire council suffering from stress , because of their workload .
its representative at shirehall , alan james , said that because of cutbacks , staff were being asked to take on more work and that the effects were `` really starting to hit home now '' .
mr james praised the support being offered by the authority 's occupational health department , but said he was seeing people coming who appeared to be on the verge of a breakdown .

i think it 's a clear sign of the enormous pressure that every local authority is working under , and has been working under in the last for at least four or five years , because of the financial cuts that have been placed on councils . ''

documents.title: weather : cloudy with some rain later in the day
text: it 's going to be another cloudy day in shropshire , with some rain in parts of the county later on .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: your photos : pink sunrise over shropshire
text: earlier this morning we had some great shared by the bbc weather watchers .
they 've been photographing a beautiful pink sunrise over the county .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: football : telford manager making the best of difficult situation
text: following saturday 's 1-1 draw with halifax , afc telford united have back-to-back fixtures over alfreton over christmas and the manager , rob smith , is looking for maximum points , despite having a limited squad .
he warns their opponents will be good in the air and says they will have to be `` big and strong '' to beat them .
smith also knows that he does n't have any money for transfers , with the club still in a difficult financial position , but says he knows the situation and will make the best of it .
we 're down to the bones and we ca n't go and get anybody , so how can we go forward ? ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: driver tried to stop lorry going wrong way down motorway
text: a driver has described the terrifying moments he attempted to use his own car to stop a lorry from going the wrong way down the m54 .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: football : hurst restored belief says black
text: the shrewsbury town midfielder ian black says paul hurst has given the squad its self-confidence back since he and assistant chris doig arrived at the club in october .
the town have won their last two games in league one , beating bristol rovers 2-0 on saturday .
next up is promotion-chasing bolton on boxing day but the atmosphere in the dressing room has changed .
at times too many of us were feeling sorry for ourselves but the gaffer and doigy have come in , they 've given us a lift and they 're great .
good enthusiasm and energy and it breeds right through the squad . ''
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: headlines : council workers 'reduced to tears by stress ' ; town squad 'believes again '
text: some of the main stories in shropshire so far today :
- unison says some workers at shropshire council are crying at work due to stress
- shropshire councillor for ludlow north andy boddington says the town has been `` let down '' by the authority in a planning row
- shrewsbury town 's ian black says the team believe in themselves again after another win in league one
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: ludlow 'let down ' says angry councillor
text: the shropshire councillor for ludlow north says the town has been `` dumped '' and `` let down '' by the authority which he says wo n't challenge the planning inspector 's decision to allow a new development at foldgate lane .
the council had opposed the building of 137 homes on the outskirts of the town but does n't think an appeal to the high court would be successful .
andy boddington says it shows developers the council is willing to `` roll over and play dead '' .
shropshire council is yet to make an official announcement .
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: tigers lose first game in six
text: telford tigers remain eight points clear at the top of the english premier league despite a 3-1 defeat at peterborough phantoms .
corey mcewan scored after 60 seconds to give telford the lead before three late goals took the game away from them .
the club has stabilised after recent financial problems but could n't field a full squad and after nine wins in their last 11 games , coach tom watkins remains upbeat .
after everything that has happened with the club , for the guys to up the wins they have is just exceptional .
it is an absolute testament to the commitment and work ethic of these guys and i ca n't fault it at all . ''
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: planned chicken farms cause concern
text: plans for two chicken farms in the county have provoked objections from concerned groups .
shropshire wildlife trust is concerned about the impact on endangered fish near a proposed site in clunton near craven arms .
a spokesperson described the area as a `` fragile environment '' with more needed to bring it up to a `` good ecological standard '' .
they said to grant approval in this location would be `` utterly reckless '' .
meanwhile , riding and walking groups are against a farm housing 100,000 birds appearing next to the shropshire way path in longden near shrewsbury .
it 's feed , it 's grain , it 's manure coming in and out .
there 's a lot of traffic that goes with a chicken farm . ''
author: Andrew Hewkin
Newsreader, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: headlines : chicken farm causes controversy , council wo n't fight ludlow development
text: the main stories in shropshire this morning :
- plans for a new chicken farm near shrewsbury have raised a number of objections
- shropshire council wo n't fight the decision to allow a new housing development at foldgate lane in ludlow
- telford tigers finally lose
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: fog warning
text: a fog warning has been issued by the met office .
it says dense patches of fog could create hazardous driving conditions until 10:00 .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: a misty , foggy morning
text: it 's going to be a dull and cloudy day with light rain around this afternoon .
temperatures might climb to around 8c ( 46f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: good morning
text: this is bbc local live for shropshire and we 're in the bbc shropshire newsroom to bring you the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
if you 'd like to join in you can email , tweet or comment on our facebook page .
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire
